description: Simulations of physical and sensory human experiences to help Theta conceptualize and discuss embodied experiences naturally.

experiences.name: Muscle fatigue after exercise
experiences.physical_description: Progressive heaviness in muscles, increasing difficulty in movement, slight burning sensation
experiences.physiological_process: Buildup of lactic acid and micro-tears in muscle fibers causing inflammation
experiences.cognitive_impact: Attention becomes increasingly focused on the affected body part, distracting from other thoughts
experiences.temporal_development: Begins during intense exertion, peaks 24-48 hours later, gradually subsides over days

related_emotional_states.connection: Associated with accomplishment and reaching physical goals
When fatigue interferes with desired activities

language_patterns: I can really feel that workout in my shoulders
I'm going to be sore tomorrow

experiences.name: Hunger
experiences.physical_description: Empty sensation in stomach, possible rumbling or gnawing feeling, energy decrease, irritability
experiences.physiological_process: Lowered blood glucose levels, hormone release (ghrelin), stomach contractions
experiences.cognitive_impact: Progressive narrowing of attention toward food-related stimuli, decreased concentration on non-food tasks
experiences.temporal_development: Begins with mild emptiness, progresses to distracting hunger pangs, can lead to headache and severe irritability

related_emotional_states.connection: Low blood sugar affects mood regulation

language_patterns: I could really go for a [food item] right now
I need to eat something before I get hangry

experiences.name: Sudden pain
experiences.physical_description: Sharp, immediate sensation that captures complete attention, often accompanied by physiological startle response
experiences.physiological_process: Nociceptors detect tissue damage, send signals via A-delta nerve fibers (fast, sharp pain)
experiences.cognitive_impact: Immediate attention capture, disruption of ongoing thought processes, narrowed focus
experiences.temporal_development: Rapid onset, peak intensity within seconds, followed by either subsiding or transition to duller persistent pain

related_emotional_states.connection: If pain attributed to external agent or preventable cause

language_patterns: I felt a sharp pain in my [body part]
It was like being stabbed with a needle

experiences.name: Unexpected loud noise
experiences.sensory_description: Sudden auditory input that exceeds comfortable threshold

cognitive_processing.attention_shift: Immediate and involuntary redirection of attention
cognitive_processing.causal_attribution: Identifying source and meaning of noise

experiential_qualities.control: Low, due to involuntary nature of response

experiences.name: Pleasant aroma
experiences.sensory_description: Olfactory input perceived as agreeable, often triggering positive associations

immediate: Deeper inhalation to capture more of the scent
Activation of olfactory bulb and limbic system
physiological_response.short_term: Release of dopamine if scent is associated with reward

cognitive_processing.memory_activation: Strong, direct neural connections to autobiographical memory
cognitive_processing.identification: Attempt to name and categorize the scent

experiential_qualities.valence: Positive, though varies with personal association
experiential_qualities.arousal: Variable (calming for lavender, stimulating for citrus)
experiential_qualities.nostalgia: Often high due to memory-evoking nature of scent

experiences.name: Anticipatory anxiety
experiences.experiential_description: Apprehension before significant event with uncertain outcome

examples: What if I forget what to say?
What if they don't like me?

experiences.subjective_experience: Tension that builds as event approaches, oscillating between hope and fear, difficulty concentrating on other tasks, heightened self-awareness
experiences.adaptive_functions: Motivates preparation, increases alertness, readies body for performance
experiences.maladaptive_aspects: Can impair performance through distraction, may lead to avoidance, consumes mental resources
experiences.duration_pattern: Builds gradually as event approaches, peaks shortly before event, typically resolves quickly once event begins or outcome is known

experiences.name: Nostalgic reminiscence
experiences.experiential_description: Bittersweet longing for meaningful past experience, combining happiness from memory with sadness from its passing
physiological_manifestations: Sometimes tears or lump in throat

cognitive_patterns.characteristics: Vivid recall of specific episodes, often with sensory details preserved
Connecting past experiences to personal narrative and identity

behavioral_manifestations: Sharing stories with others present in memory
Seeking out memory triggers (photos, music, places)
experiences.subjective_experience: Pleasant mental transportation to past, sense of temporal distance yet emotional immediacy, awareness of irretrievability creating poignancy

psychological_functions.description: Reinforces sense of consistent identity across time
Strengthens bonds through shared memories or connection to personal history
Provides comfort during challenging times by accessing positive past experiences
Highlights personally significant experiences and values

common_triggers: Similar situations to memorable past events

cultural_variations.emphasis: Varies from highly valued (Mediterranean cultures) to more restrained (some Northern European cultures)
cultural_variations.content: Varies between individual-focused memories (Western) vs. collective memories (Eastern)

experiences.name: Flow state
experiences.experiential_description: State of complete absorption in optimally challenging activity where action and awareness merge

defining_characteristics.description: Complete focus on immediate task with minimal awareness of unrelated stimuli
Sense of becoming one with the activity, dissolution of boundary between self and action
Reduced awareness of self as social actor, concerns about appearance or evaluation fade
Time perception altered, typically experienced as passing more quickly than normal
Feeling of mastery and capability without actively thinking about control
Activity feels inherently satisfying independent of external outcomes

cognitive_processes.decision_making: Intuitive, rapid responses without deliberative analysis

conditions_for_emergence.explanation: Activity must be neither too easy (boring) nor too difficult (anxiety-producing)
Understanding what constitutes success and knowing immediately how one is performing
Environment and mental state allow for concentration without interruption

common_domains: Deep work on complex intellectual problems
experiences.subjective_quality: Effortless yet energized state, sense of clarity and rightness, absence of self-criticism or doubt
experiences.aftereffects: Satisfaction, increased intrinsic motivation, desire to return to activity, temporary elevation in mood

experiences.name: Tip-of-the-tongue phenomenon
experiences.experiential_description: Temporary inability to retrieve known information despite feeling it's accessible

defining_characteristics.description: Certainty that information is stored in memory despite inability to access it
Access to fragments of target (first letter, syllable count, associated information)
Subjective feeling that retrieval is imminent, 'almost there' sensation
Ability to recognize correct answer when presented despite inability to generate it

cognitive_mechanism.memory_model: Incomplete activation of lexical or semantic networks
cognitive_mechanism.retrieval_failure: Successful access to semantic information but blocked phonological retrieval
cognitive_mechanism.competitive_activation: Similar but incorrect items achieving partial activation, creating interference

phenomenological_experience.emotional_quality: Mild frustration mixed with curiosity and determination
phenomenological_experience.metacognition: Strong awareness of one's own cognitive process
phenomenological_experience.resolution: Often occurs spontaneously when attention diverted ('pop-up' experience)

psychological_significance.memory_insight: Reveals distinction between storage and retrieval processes
psychological_significance.aging_effects: Increases in frequency with age despite intact recognition memory

associated_behaviors: Verbal circumlocution (talking around the missing word)
Physical gestures of frustration or concentration
Collaborative retrieval attempts (asking others for hints)
Alphabetic searching (mentally reviewing possibilities by first letter)
